description: Goalkeeper Mary Earps says the England squad is a "resilient group" who will "keep fighting" despite further injury setbacks.
title: Women's World Cup 2023: Mary Earps - Lionesses 'resilient' after injuries
title_page: Women's World Cup 2023: Mary Earps - Lionesses 'resilient' after injuries - BBC Sport
maintext:
Goalkeeper Mary Earps says the England squad is a "resilient group" that will "keep fighting" in the Women's World Cup despite another injury setback.
Midfielder Keira Walsh picked up a knee issue against Denmark and although she does not have an anterior cruciate ligament injury, she will miss the final group game against China.
The Lionesses lost key players Leah Williamson, Beth Mead and Fran Kirby to injury before the tournament started.
"We're a 'together' group," said Earps.
"I think you've seen that through the adversity we've faced coming into the tournament. We'll have to wait and see whether it [Walsh's injury] is serious.
"It's tough. You could see it disrupted our rhythm in the first half. It's always sad when you see your team-mate go down and I hope it is nothing too serious.
"We are a resilient group. We're going to keep going and fighting and putting our best foot forward - as we always do."
